intro: Bowkeria cymosa, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and slightly hairy, while the flowers range in color from white to pale blue. Bowkeria cymosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
